+package net.fabricmc.fabric.api.gamerule.v1;
+
+import net.minecraft.world.GameRules;
+
+import net.fabricmc.fabric.impl.gamerule.RuleKeyInternals;
+import net.fabricmc.fabric.mixin.gamerule.GameRulesAccessor;
+
+public final class GameRuleRegistry {
+	private GameRuleRegistry() {
+	}
+
+	/**
+	 * Registers a {@link GameRules.Rule}.
+	 *
+	 * @param name   the name of the rule
+	 * @param category the category of this rule
+	 * @param type the rule type
+	 * @param <T>  the type of rule
+	 * @return a rule key which can be used to query the value of the rule
+	 * @throws IllegalStateException if a rule of the same name already exists
+	 */
+	public static <T extends GameRules.Rule<T>> GameRules.RuleKey<T> register(String name, GameRules.RuleCategory category, GameRules.RuleType<T> type) {
+		return GameRulesAccessor.invokeRegister(name, category, type);
+	}
+
+	/**
+	 * Registers a {@link GameRules.Rule} with a custom category.
+	 *
+	 * @param name 	the name of the rule
+	 * @param category the category of this rule
+	 * @param type the rule type
+	 * @param <T>  the type of rule
+	 * @return a rule key which can be used to query the value of the rule
+	 * @throws IllegalStateException if a rule of the same name already exists
+	 */
+	public static <T extends GameRules.Rule<T>> GameRules.RuleKey<T> register(String name, CustomGameRuleCategory category, GameRules.RuleType<T> type) {
+		final GameRules.RuleKey<T> key = GameRulesAccessor.invokeRegister(name, GameRules.RuleCategory.MISC, type);
+		((RuleKeyInternals) (Object) key).fabric_setCustomCategory(category);
+		return key;
+	}
+
+	/**
+	 * Checks if a name for a rule is already being used.
+	 *
+	 * @param ruleName the rule name to test
+	 * @return true if the name is taken.
+	 */
+	public static boolean isRuleNameUsed(String ruleName) {

timeline.bodyText:
Change this to a single line return with a ternary operator?
return iterator.hasNext() ? iterator.next() : values.iterator().next();
timeline.author: Geometrically

replies.bodyText: At least there shouldn't be an else statement after a return statement
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: Yea, I've collapsed it to the ternary operator
replies.author: i509VCB

timeline.bodyText: Hmm I need to fix these (Shouldn't be integer max here)
timeline.author: i509VCB

timeline.bodyText: typo "ofa"
timeline.author: sfPlayer1

timeline.bodyText: return d >= minimumValue && d <= maximumValue, cleaner and rejects NaN
timeline.author: sfPlayer1

timeline.bodyText: Checking Double.isInfinity and Double.isNan here for value and both bounds sounds like something we should do?
timeline.author: sfPlayer1
sfPlayer1

timeline.bodyText: supportedValues is private, no need to wrap this way. I'd turn it into ArrayList if it isn't a List already instead, which simplifies the other methods.
timeline.author: sfPlayer1

timeline.bodyText: return supportedValues.contains(value);
timeline.author: sfPlayer1

timeline.bodyText: Validate if value is in supportedValues? This also implicitly rejects empty supportedValues.
timeline.author: sfPlayer1
sfPlayer1

timeline.bodyText: There is no validation that the supplied rule is compatible with this one, should check if rule.value is in supportedValues
timeline.author: sfPlayer1

timeline.bodyText: There is no validation that rule.value respects the same bounds.
timeline.author: sfPlayer1

timeline.bodyText: Review comments from DoubleRule apply. I'm not 100% sure if it makes sense to have FloatRule though, DoubleRule is just a cast and reasonable bounds selection away from serving practically the same purpose.
timeline.author: sfPlayer1

timeline.bodyText: DoubleRule.parseDouble confused me at the first look, I didn't expect it to specify the class for a local call and read Double.parseDouble instead.
timeline.author: sfPlayer1

timeline.bodyText: This is a single-use utility method that also changes how the implementation deals with invalid values. EnumRule does nothing for deserialize(invalid), while this one sets the value to 0 unless it happened to be outside the valid range. So either a surprising 0-value or a 2nd redundant warning.
timeline.author: sfPlayer1
JamiesWhiteShirt
JamiesWhiteShirt

timeline.message: Fix translation keys and update to 20w22a
Command results and remove unnessecary factory method
Update to 1.16-pre3, change enum button style

Rename some parts to compensate for future yarn renames.

Flatten some logic related to EnumRules

Convert colors to hex

Co-authored-by: Erlend Åmdal <erlend@aamdal.com>
